Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, old school hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexPtraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall: If you consider the location it's a must! Good value too. Location: Walking distance to Taksim Square and Istiklal Street. We were really lucky with the location. Very safe and quiet area even though it's full of hotels and restaurants. Buffet: Very rich breakfast. We were happy with it. Staff: Staff were very polite and smiley. A major issue for me though was almost everyone's command of English apart from a blonde receptionist who was perfect. People just didn't seem to be able to speak or understand English & didn't seem to want to accept it. They would bring you a wrong coffee at the caffe, give you wrong directions, or just generally not understand. But they do try to help for sure. Was with a group of people and they all had issues with this. a 4 star superior hotel should not have this issue. Room design and size: Clean, normal size. Could go with a little re-design to make it more modern though. Was just fine though I have to say.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: hraghad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two weeks as a family of six people. The staff act nice at the first but then they stare at you when you talk to them. escpecially as a family, they keep coming in our hall stand in front of our door listening and writing something on paper. the breakfast is nice but expensive. the staff is pregedice and dont respect islam. in the pool you must wear a bikini or no entering. they put food (ex:wine chips, choclate, &beer) in the middle (for money) of the room . which is hard for the kids to avoid so apperently my kids fished it and the next day they put more food! like i said NEVER good for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality hotel with the great location”
Reviews.Author: SNR79
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel in March 2012. it's a very good quality hotel with very experienced and helpful personnel. You could call to house keeping, reception or guest relation and would get assistance immediately. Reception personnel were really very kind and ready to explain any place to visit in Istanbul even what kind of transport can be used. Separate thanks to house keeping for very good level of cleanliness not only in the room but in the corridors/floors/lobby as well Very good and testy food has been prepared and served at the breakfast and in the hotel restaurant. The location of the hotel is really very good - close to Taksim square, Dolmabakhche palace and Nisantasi I would advise this hotel to all to Istanbul tourists

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scratch81
Reviews.Content: Firstly location - if you fly easyjet and land at Sabiha Gocken Airport, then you can take a Havatas coach from outside the terminal, at a cost of 12Lira per person, and drop off at Taksim Square. The Hotel is within a 2-3 minute walk from the square, hence very close to the dropoff point for the havatas coach. Istiklal Street, which is the equivalent of oxford street with shops, restaurants, and bars off the side alleys is within 5 min walk as well. The Hotel - Looks very nice, with service from entry onwards. The swimming pool, hamam and sauna in the basement are a great bonus. It has a gym - but i wouldnt call it that - its a small room with a couple of machines. The breakfast had a good choice of options, the only difficulty was the service - tables were not cleaned, and the staff quite surly. The room we stayed in was a good size (Room 517), the only problem was that there was a service door opposite where staff would constantly rush through and the door would slam shut, hence shuddering the whole corridor and the room. Otherwise the rooms were adequate with minibar, pillow menu etc. The surroundings have quite a few kebab shops - recommend Faro kebabs with good quality food. We tried a couple of others eg HajiBaba, but the food was quite dry and burnt. Also recommend a small kebab shop on the corner called enya (i think) which also offered Narghile (sheesha)

Reviews.Title: “It is a nice hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: almandilawi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located at the heart of Istanbul(Taksem) and the service was very good and the breakfast open Buffet is full with delicious food and drinks,the hotel have all the necessary facilities needed by the tourist,also there is nice swimming pool at the basement of the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “An Honorable and Comfortable Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arash56
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great location, about 2 minutes walk from Taksim square and so quiet rooms. me and my wife and my two little doughter were stay 4 nights in this unforgettable hotel!!! All of staff was Polite,Honorable and Friendly. Our room was similar to the pictures that we already seen in the hotel web site. Rooms are spacious and well decorated, bathrooms was clean and Sanitary.I had just a little problem with WiFi connection but another things was really really great. I will come back to there again.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Seasondtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is an expensive four-star hotel but in more ways than one it feels like a three-star place. The location is good, though far from the old centre of town, but there are some drawbacks. One is that sound insulation is poor, so I was woken up several times during the night by noisy neighbours. Another is that the bathroom fixtures are not great for this class of hotels. A third one is that the wifi connection is mediocre in some rooms. I did not have the time to test the (small) pool in the basement. Overall, the website looks much better than the reality and this place is a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Robert J
Reviews.Content: We stayed in LaresPark as this was the venue for a conference we attended. We found it to be clean, comfortable and good value. The staff were excellent, very helpful and most could speak English. The restaurent and the breakfast buffet were very good - we can recommend the Turkish wines.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent hotel, terrible wi-fi"”
Reviews.Author: brazilian_tourist
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve just arrived from a 3-night stay in this hotel. Its location is perfect, very close to Taksim Square, where there are many options of restaurants, stores and a very lively nightlife. On the other hand, you will need to take a taxi to visit major touristic attractions. Staff is very helpful and professional. Room had a very good size and was comfortable and clean. breakfast had tons of options to choose from. The only bad thing is the internet access in the room. It simply did not existed in my room on the 5th floor. Everytime I wanted to use the internet, I had to go to the elevators hall of the 5th floor. Simply ridiculous. Hotel restaurant is a good option for dinner. Overall, it is a great hotel, but if you are on a business trip and need to use the internet, youÂ´d better consider another option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Shervivor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Larespark for two weeks for business. You cannot beat the location; the hotel is a mere two walking blocks from Taksim Square, which is my preferred place to stay while in Istanbul. You can spend your evenings walking on Istiklal Street, or even walking the neighborhood directly around the hotel. There is a great restaurant just across from the hotel called Beyruti, which has very accommodating staff and you can sit outside in the nice weather. Much better food and prices than what is served at the hotel restaurant. The rooms at Larespark are comfortable. The bathroom is large, the beds are comfy, the rooms are clean. There were a couple of things that weren't so great. I was on the back side of the hotel and the street there has a nightclub that plays pumping beats until the early morning on weekends. Yet the pumping beats do not rival the lovely mating wails of the neighborhood stray cats. This cacophony had an eerie luster as it climbed up and echoed back and forth off the buildings. And the cats did not stop wailing in the early morning; you were likely to hear them at any hour of the day. I know both of these things are beyond the control of the hotel and it is just a small price you pay to stay in the middle of the action that is found in Taksim. The elevators are also a little slow at times as there are only two. The breakfast buffet was insanely huge with tons of choices and some different items every day. One thing I did have an issue with was being accused by the hotel staff of having an extra person in my room I did not pay for. I have many friends living in Istanbul and had several of them visit me in my room. Some were visiting for several hours one night and the next day I had a note under my door asking me to call reception. I was then asked if I was a double or a single in the room. Really? When I checked in I told them I was a single, and I was not lying, it was just me sleeping there. I didn't know that they were spying on me each time I entered the hotel lobby to see who was accompanying me. This incident greatly upset me as I felt they were accusing me a being a liar and I also felt as though I was being spied on by the staff. It was a bit of a creepy experience. But other than the one incident the staff was very helpful in other ways; exchanging money, making small change, helping with directions and Istanbul information. The housekeeping staff was very good and even left me an extra towel when I asked for one. Overall, I enjoyed staying at Larespark because I was able to spend my evenings in one of my favorite neighborhoods in the entire world! The hotel is a decent value for the price based on the quality and the location. Be aware though if you are staying in Taksim and will take a taxi to Sultanahmet to see the sites, make sure you ask the taxi driver what the approximate cost will be before you get in his car! It should be around 12 - 14 lira one way using the meter. If they quote you 30 lira they are going to cheat you! Istanbul taxi drivers are notorious for ripping off tourists. I even experienced two drivers that manipulated the meter to increase the fair. I caught them in the act. They don't expect you to be watching them because there is too much to see out the windows of the car. Keep your eye on them, if they touch the meter make them pull over and get a different cab. These cheating taxi drivers really give the honest ones a bad name. Tourists are the lifeblood of so many people in Istanbul that it is truly a shame that some idiot taxi drivers can tarnish a great experience by trying to make a few extra lira off of naive tourists. Public transportation is an option but unless you read Turkish or have someone that can show you the ropes it can be a little complicated the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in Taksim Sq”
Reviews.Author: CraigSLondon
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this is , with swift easy transfers to a exciting part of Istanbul. Very spacious rooms well kept and clean. Indoor pool , turkish baths and gym all kept neat clean and very hygenic. Wonderful coffee shop with amazing turkish deserts/cakes. One of the fastest check ins i have ever experianced . Very good front desk staff very helpful , just watch out for taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “The fastest Check-in on the universe!”
Reviews.Author: TokAlis
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights on a business trip. Check took less than 3 minutes which was wonderful since I was exhausted. The room was extremely clean and was kept clean and made even if i didn't ask for it. This hotel is on a stay green mission which i totally loved. The front desk were very helpful and room service was very quick and the food was delicious! Breakfast boufet could have been a bit more diverse but the coffee was excellent and that's all i really needed. The free wifi was good and the most important thing is the that the hotel was location which is amazing and was close to everything although I was on a business trip and didn't really have much time for site seeing but if i were to go on a shopping trip Lares Park is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: Monchon
Reviews.Content: I liked the LaresPark. I was in Istanbul for a conference/fun. The hotel is convenient to the funicular/train over to the old town (very fast service) and Istiklar street (tons of shopping). I had an interior room with no windows, but it was huge and even had a sitting area. Breakfast was excellent. The workout facility was modest - just a bike/treadmill and a few weights and another machine that you had to pay extra to use. The pool looked nice, but we didn't go in. Free wifi was fast throughout my room. I appreciated the bottle of water in the morning and that they had a cab 'on call' who always used the meter.

Reviews.Title: “Don't say (4+), Please say (More than 5)”
Reviews.Author: aezzeldin79
Reviews.Content: I Swear it is an Excellent Hotel, Helpful Staff, Good Location, in addition to the AMAZING BREAKFAST.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: willsmama
Reviews.Content: First - the positive. The room (a junior suite) was spacious and bright. The beds (two twins and a pull-out sofa) were comfortable with lovely linens and pillows. The breakfast buffet was bountiful and the coffee delicious. BUT: the Front Desk staff treated us with such rudeness when we checked in that our tour guide called his company from the lobby to report on the churlish behavior. We were polite and friendly and caught off-guard by the poor attitude. But, we decided to let it go and went on up to our room. Surprise - the bath-tub was dirty (someone's hair -ugh), and there was a strong sewage smell. We called the front desk to request the bathroom be re-cleaned which was done almost immediately. However, the strange odor lingered. A plumber arrived, knocked on the bathroom walls, flushed the toilet a few times and sprayed something in the corners. Surprisingly, the odor dissipated for awhile, but returned with a vengeance later that night. It was so strong that we had trouble sleeping. We would have changed hotels but since we were there for only two nights we decided to stay put. Also, there were only 2 bath-towels and one robe/slippers for 3 people. We padded around in our socks which turned dark from the obviously unclean hardwood floor. All in all - not a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but Wifi is baad”
Reviews.Author: Ali H
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, lovely rooms, lovely restaurant, and the best thing are the confortable pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, But Baaad Sleep !!!”
Reviews.Author: Kuwaitian
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel in a good location in Taksim with a good staff and good room. Not that good but still reasonable.. The main problem we had is the Noise !!! It come from everywhere! Discos, bars, motorcycles and people in the street outside, you can also hear people talking and phones ringing in the rooms next to you and above you, house keeping staff outside the room shouting at each other!, Doors slammed everywhere ... etc. I don't know what thier walls are made from (!), but I know I'm not going there again ...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dzinte
Reviews.Content: Husband was at a conference and I went for some local sightseeing... Hotel is close to Taksim Square - lots of places to eat nearby. Cost me 45 Lira for a taxi at night but you can go from/ to airport via funicular from Taksim and 2 trams for under 4.5 lira - just takes time. Breakfast OK.Easy to get to Tourist sites by taxi or public transport. Traffic hectic and pavements are not in good condition - so mind your step. Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff/service, great location”
Reviews.Author: AntsSA
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights towards the end of August. We arrived at the hotel early and were accommodated with an early check-in (requested in advance, but too often hotels say they will do their best and nothing comes of it!). The reception and other staff were very friendly. Best thing about the hotel in my opinion is its location - just off Taksim Square (not right on the square where it can be very busy/noisy). The hotel also has a great restaurant and spa (complete with mini hamam). On the whole I have no complaints whatsoever about the hotel and would gladly go there again and recommend to friends without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep but ...”
Reviews.Author: Chailey_Paul
Reviews.Content: Dont try and sleep after 9:00 am the hotel is being refurbished and the noise is painful. Breakfast is hit and miss but the coffee was good. Didn't use the facilities so cant really judge. More geared to leisure visitors but free wireless is a boon. Clean room, comfy bed so overall no issues. Good central location but in a pedestrianised area so you may need to walk with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly, helpful, and honest!!!”
Reviews.Author: SONIA2009
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel between 17 & 24 july 2010.the personnel was very helpful and supported me when a local travel agency tried to play dirty tricks with me.they are professional but very kind and helpful.the rooms are very good, i took the luxury room, the breackfast delicious and diversified, the location is great :very close to taksim square and metro and bus stations. i really recommand it to all trip advisor users.finally i would like to say hi to the front office team especially "levent" and "cihan" for their back up during my stay!!!!!!thank u for ur help!!!!you are really great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was very very good. A four star hotel pretending to be a five star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Notsoditsy
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old son and my self stayed at the hotel for eight days. I liked the ambience of the hotel, quite luxurious and very clean. The staff curteous and professional and happy to assist you. A bit expensive but I have always been one to want to stay in a nice hotel rather then spend loads on shopping that I dont need. The location is also ideal for transport and getting around town, it's just 5 mins away from Taksim square and shopping street of Istikial Caddesi. The hotel is tucked away in one of the side roads which shields you from the hustle and bustle of the square. Breakfast buffet at 15 euros per person was a bit pricey, so we gave that a miss and ate out most days which is much cheaper and because of the location lots of places to eat. There is nothing I can say I dont like about the hotel, aah....one thing, dont book the hotel transfer too expensive at 70 euros one way....it's far cheaper to take the airport shuttle bus at 5 euros/ or 10 TLs per person. The airport shuttle bus brings you to Taksim square and the hotel is 5 mins away. I will say very good.....punching very high indeed. ! I will gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Num_Tee
Reviews.Content: First time in Istanbul and the location was pretty good but in a very hotel centric area. Really handy for restaurants and shops in Istikal Caddesi. Also handy for tram or buses. The hotel was clean and the room was spacious and quiet. The fitness center and pool was quite small compared to most others I have been in. The breakfast buffet choice was excellent and food was very tasty. The only thing the hotel needs to work on is just the customer service level of employees.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you understand the payment terms”
Reviews.Author: RayBerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel starting on May 1, 2010 thru May 4, 2010. Unfortunately due to the May Day celebration on May 1st in Takizm square we could not get to the hotel and had to stay in another hotel the first night. The Larspark would not refund our first night due to the fact that they were "fully booked". That meant paying for two hotels. Even if the hotel was nice and in a good location for the reason above I would not stay at this hotel again. My advice make sure you understand thier policies before booking there.

Reviews.Title: “LaresPark Hotel Istanbul Luxury Blissful Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: MamaOsyMimi
Reviews.Content: Larespark Hotel is a luxurious, blissful hotel which felt just like home! With its perfect central location, great amenities and scrumptious breakfast, we loved our short stay and plan to return in the Summer. Ms. Olakanpo +234 803 403 0309 bumiolakanpo@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not the worst in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aoudjana
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite spacious, the hotel is nice and well located in Taksim area. The staff at the reception need to be more smiley and less rigid and formal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: esquire29
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a block from the Taksim which is in the heart of the city. The street where the hotel is located looks very European with nice flower-beds, small cafes and shops selling a little bit of everything. When you walk into this quarter from the Taksim and Ä°stiklal seething with tourists and vendors, life slows down a little here, which gives the area some charm. Every morning we would go out from the hotel and have a cigarette in calm before diving into hustle and bustle of the big city. In addition to its ideal location the hotel offers very good, spacious and clean rooms. The interior of the hotel in general is very cosy with soft light, carpets and elegant chairs in the corridors. It's true four star hotel. The staff doesn't seem to show much their presence, but on the other hand if you ask them something they will kindly response. Anyway, I didn't find any fault while staying there. So, next time I'll choose it again. I don't think I'll find better 4 star for this money in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RintintinPraha
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel together with group of colleagues from my office. The service was very good, room spacious and very clean. Breakfast was also above average. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. Normally I stay in Marmara hotel on Taksim while on business but I think this hotel matches Marmara and it is (or at least during my visit it was) less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Incompentent Staff”
Reviews.Author: salexan2
Reviews.Content: The interpersonal skills of the hotel staff are lacking severly. Never, in my world travels to over 33 countries, have I experienced harassment by hotel staff until now. They were rude to my guests and could not locate a package shipped to the hotel although a member of the staff signed for the delivery. Moreover, the facilities are in need of maintenance. In the gym, two pieces of equipement were unuseable; they were hazardous in fact. I would not recommend this hotel for any type of travel, business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Read this”
Reviews.Author: TrueUK
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - delightful staff - beautiful room / gorgeous bedding & tea/coffee facilities . Not far from Taksim Sq . No complaints at all but BEWARE 'restaurants' nearby . On our first night wanted simple meal - went in LIAR CAFE almost oppostite hotel . - food appears cheap , invited upstairs to 'grand dining area ' but whilst charming the 'head waiter' is a con looking to rip you off with the wine ( food is not great either ) . AVOID this cafe at all costs

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for Money”
Reviews.Author: avihub
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! The room is not big, but not too small. Great breakfast (though expensive - 15 EUR) Staff speaks good English and was very helpful Free internet!

Reviews.Title: “I had no problems at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roundman436
Reviews.Content: I just completed a six night stay in connection with a business convention in Istanbul and found nothing to dislike about the LaresPark. My room on the 8th floor was clean and comfortable. I received good service by the desk, lobby and door staff in twice each day arranging taxi pickup and instructing the driver on my destinations. Service by the restaurant waiters and bar staff and service was excellent. The breakfast included in my rate was exceptional with eggs prepared to order if requested. It is located in a pedestrian section with the only vehicular traffic being taxis to the hotels and commercial deliveries. A friend on the 2nd floor said there was little street noise, even on the Republic Day national holiday when nearby Taksim Square was a festival madhouse and fireworks over the Bosporus. I would recommend it to anyone seeking modest priced accommodations near the commercial center of the European side of the city.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: Bodza
Reviews.Content: we stayed there with a group of friends for 2 nights. the hotel is located right next to taksim in a separated area - meaning that youÂ´ve felt like in a ghetto. against any previous agreements breakfast was not included in the price which iÂ´ve found cheeky. especiall after a small discussion about the MOULD in our bathroom - the whole shower area was BLACK. some humming and apologies but no acting. badly done from the reception. the rooms facing the street are very noisy. brings your earplugs. otherwise they were cosy and well equipped apart from the missing garbage-can, we only found one in the bathroom. the small spa was nice, especially the pool. all in all not so bad, but for the price one can get something better and with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, otherwise good”
Reviews.Author: Anton_8
Reviews.Content: If by any chance you come to paint the Beyoglu District red, that's your kind of hotel: clean, comfortable, entertainment-oriented. Some may not like distant and kind of business-like manners of Larespark's reception and guest relations, I am not like that, I do not care for their smiles. What I reallly din't like was noise. I was lucky enough to stay at Larespark when they organized a carnival outside. Deafening music amplified as much as it was physically possible didn't stop till midnight. Not only could I not get to bed, I could not even hear the TV. That stay of mine turned out a nightmare. On the other hand, those looking for festivities must have enjoyed that night. You look for peace and calm - you'll be better off without Larespark, you look for happenings - go right there. If it hadn't been for that noise, I'd have called Larespark spotless

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable refuge from the chaos of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sdmike48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LaresPark for five nights in August 2008, and found it to be comfortable and clean. The staff was very competent and the desk clerks were fluent in English and German, and extremely helpful. The area around Taksim square is very busy and confusing, and there were numerous incidents of pickpocketing reported while I was there, so caution is the best advice. Each room has a secure combination safe. Best to use it and leave extra credit cards and valuables there. The breakfast at the hotel an incredible buffet with familiar and unfamiliar foods, and beautiful breads and pastries. One can take good advantage of this and make each day a two meal day.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ADMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights end of May and June 2008. reserved room thru a conference site, so got the breakfast included in the room price. The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms are clean, with good water pressure. I asked for a non-smoking room, but had a smoking room, but even with a very sensitive nose had no problems. Turkish bathrobe, slippers, English language newspaper and an electric kettle were all nice amenities. The wireless internet worked well. The beds/linens were very nice. Terrific breakfast with lots of choices--salads, yogurts, cereals, fruit, cold cuts, cheeses, breads, olives, hot foods. Very convenient to Taksim square and Istiklal street, with the cablecars and metro. What's not to like? Well, there are no electric outlets to plug in things like the computer and camera battery charger. why have wireless internet and then not have a place to charge the computer?? I unplugged some lamps. Someone also mentioned the lack of clocks--this is really true--glad I brought my own. Lastly, the open air restaurant in the hotel--the Portofino--has live music every night (and not very good music at that) including some very bad trumpet players and oh dear god--karaoke on the Saturday night I arrived with jetlag--The music is very accoustically transmitted thru the windows. I don't mind some street noise, but the bad lounge music was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: HaarlemTheNeterlands
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice. Great hotel, excellent location, very friendly staff. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. The pool, sauna and hamam are very nice as well. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. We would definately stay at Larespark again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive LaresPark”
Reviews.Author: Matti-Pringle
Reviews.Content: It was a very welcome surprise to start my first work related trip of 2008 with a hotel as impressive as the Larespark, which was splendid in every respect. The room was full of those little extras which make a stay so much more enjoyable such as a bathrobe, tea and coffee, a free English language newspaper in the morning, a copy of Timeout, a choice of pillows and even a shoe polishing kit. Moreover, the staff are polite and helpful to the man and woman. The location just of Taksim Square is also a major selling point, though be aware of the local restaurant and bar touts. Return I will!

Reviews.Title: “A not so 4*+ hotel”
Reviews.Author: nat_gr
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Larespark hotel for three nights beginning the 3rd January (2 adults+2 children aged 9 &6). The hotel is supposed to be a 4*+ hotel , but I believe that is an average 4* hotel. The rooms were clean and spacy , and the breakfast was ok. The service though was poor . We left the hotel at 9.30 in the morning , and when we returned at 16.00 the rooms were not ready.We kindly asked for the rooms to be made. We had to wait for two hours at the lobby bar until the rooms were ready , and nobody came to inform us.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Appearance But Little Else”
Reviews.Author: skyguyWI
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation directly on the hotel's website at a promotional rate of â‚¬89 plus tax (total per night--â‚¬105). At the current exchange rate, that was USD155 per night. When I booked the reservation, I indicated that I was requesting the airport transfers that were offered on the booking screen. I gave my full flight arrival information. When I received my confirmation from the hotel, I assumed everything was set. I arrived in Istanbul on schedule only to find that there was no one from the hotel to pick me up. I waited for 45 minutes and finally gave up. I was then on my own to find my way to the hotel. On arrival at the hotel, I asked the front desk clerk why the hotel failed to provide the transfers I had requested. At first she said they didn't even offer such a service and said I should contact the travel agency who booked my reservation. I told her I booked directly with the hotel on their website. She then made a phone call to a colleague, She said her colleague said she sent me an email requesting that I confirm that I really wanted the transfer I was requesting on my booking. I never received any such email. When I got off the lift on my floor, I found the hallways dark. The lights were all controlled by motion dectectors. My room was in the corner. The lights went on but stayed on for only five seconds. (I timed them.) Fortunately there was an emergency exit light so I could see the slot to insert my room key card. For the prices this hotel charged, I think they could have afforded to keep the hallways lit. The room was nicely appointed and very comfortable. Unfortunately the walls were paper thin. The people in the next room had a baby with them. I could hear every word they said, and I could hear every grunt the baby made. I learned the hard way that hot water was plentiful, but cold water was in very short supply. When I turned on the water to what should have been a lukewarm setting on the faucet, I burned my finger. The water was scalding. There seemed to be two temperatures: hot and scalding. One other thing that seemed odd was that there was no clock of any type anywhere in the room. Fortunately, I had brought my own travel alarm clock. Once again, for the price of this hotel, a simple amenity such as a clock should have been standard room equipment. I did check out the recreation facilities. The pool area was very nice. There was a co-ed Turkish bath and sauna. One downside involved the lack of lighting again. The changing area was a room without lights. Fortunately there was a small, closet type room where I could turn on the light. It was the only light that worked. It was difficult to see my locker in the dark. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel and definitely would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: JRMountain
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - Got an excellent spacious room - All the luxury amenities. The hotel has an excellent pool/sauna/turkish bath. The location is great. In the new part of the town - lively! On the downside, the staff seems a bit junior -not really sophisticated- dealing with customers. They lacked a concierge so when you ask questions about places to eat, etc, they have no clue! If you know where you going then it should be fine - or ask other hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: hombil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Larespark Hotel, Istanbul, Turkey during our 4-day stay. It was booked thru a travel agent in Oman, as part of a tour package and we are glad that we opted for this hotel. The check-in was smooth, the staff very courteous and overall service was good. The room was spacious and housekeeping was good. I would rate their breakfast as best in town for the price. Overall, I would rate this hotel as excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern business hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the LaresPark in Taksim, Beyoglu. The location is very good to explore the newer part of Istanbul where life never seems to stop. The room was spacious, the bedding of good quality, the only issue I would note would be that the windows were too small so that little daylight would get in the room. Access to the gym, swimming pool, jacuzzi and turkish bath was free. Everything very well equipped and very clean. Staff was welcoming and nice. Overall a good hotel, but nothing exotic. I remain surprised by the prices of hotels in Turkey (we paid 140 â‚¬ / night for a double)

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: johncharles
Reviews.Content: Booking the LaresPark (pronounced Larispark) was a bit of a shot in the dark since, at the time, it only just scraped into Istanbul's top 40 hotels on the TripAdvisor website. But we were delighted. The location is excellent --- 100 yards from Taksim Square --- yet on a quiet pedestrianised side street. Taksim Square and its adjoining park are, admittedly, very unattractive. But it is a hub for evening activities and public transport. The bedroom was perfectly adequate with double glazing and air conditioning. Two outstanding features --- the beautifully-decorated health spa had a swimming pool, jacuzzi, authentic Turkish bath, sauna and fiendish gym equipment. The breakfast, including made-to-order omelettes, was outstanding. Add to that attentive and professsional staff. They are trying really hard to make this hotel something special. Apart from the usual tourist sights we have three suggestions for trips out. Fatih Mosque (bus 87B from Taksim) on a Wednesday has a huge outdoor market around the walls. One of the best ferry rides is from Eyup on the Golden Horn across to Uskudar on the Asian side. And you can hire bikes on the car-free islands of Heybeliada and Buyukada. We had a great week and if we return it will be to the LaresPark.
